verses.verse: What <S%G5101><s%> shall we say <S%G2046><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> that Abraham <S%G11><s%> our father, <S%G3962><s%> as pertaining to the flesh, <S%G4561><s%> has found? <S%G2147><s%>
For if <S%G1487><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> were justified <S%G1344><s%> by works, <S%G2041><s%> he has <S%G2192><s%> whereof to glory; <S%G2745><s%> but not before <S%G4314><s%> God. <S%G2316><s%>

For what <S%G5101><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> the scripture? <S%G1124><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> believed <S%G4100><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> and it was counted <S%G3049><s%> to him for righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> to him that works <S%G2038><s%> is the reward <S%G3408><s%> not reckoned <S%G3049><s%> of grace, <S%G5485><s%> but of debt. <S%G3783><s%>

But to him that works <S%G2038><s%> not, but believes <S%G4100><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> him that justifies <S%G1344><s%> the ungodly, <S%G765><s%> his faith <S%G4102><s%> is counted <S%G3049><s%> for righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>

Even <S%G2509><s%> as David <S%G1138><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> describes <S%G3004><s%> the blessedness <S%G3108><s%> of the man, <S%G444><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> imputes <S%G3049><s%> righteousness <S%G1343><s%> without <S%G5565><s%> works, <S%G2041><s%>
Saying, Blessed <S%G3107><s%> are they whose <S%G3739><s%> iniquities <S%G458><s%> are forgiven, <S%G863><s%> and whose <S%G3739><s%> sins <S%G266><s%> are covered. <S%G1943><s%>
Blessed <S%G3107><s%> is the man <S%G435><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> will not impute <S%G3049><s%> sin. <S%G266><s%>

Comes this <S%G3778><s%> blessedness <S%G3108><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> on the circumcision <S%G4061><s%> only, or <S%G2228><s%> on the uncircumcision <S%G203><s%> also? <S%G2532><s%> for we say <S%G3004><s%> that faith <S%G4102><s%> was reckoned <S%G3049><s%> to Abraham <S%G11><s%> for righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>

How <S%G4459><s%> was it then <S%G3767><s%> reckoned? <S%G3049><s%> when he was in circumcision, <S%G4061><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> in uncircumcision? <S%G203><s%> Not in circumcision, <S%G4061><s%> but in uncircumcision. <S%G203><s%>

And he received <S%G2983><s%> the sign <S%G4592><s%> of circumcision, <S%G4061><s%> a seal <S%G4973><s%> of the righteousness <S%G1343><s%> of the faith <S%G4102><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> he had yet being uncircumcised: <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3588><s%> <S%G203><s%> that he might be the father <S%G3962><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> them that believe, <S%G4100><s%> though <S%G1223><s%> they be not circumcised; <S%G203><s%> that righteousness <S%G1343><s%> might be imputed <S%G3049><s%> to them also: <S%G2532><s%>

And the father <S%G3962><s%> of circumcision <S%G4061><s%> to them who <S%G3588><s%> are not of the circumcision <S%G4061><s%> only, <S%G3440><s%> but who <S%G3588><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> walk <S%G4748><s%> in the steps <S%G2487><s%> of that faith <S%G4102><s%> of our father <S%G3962><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> which he had being yet uncircumcised. <S%G1722><s%>

For the promise, <S%G1860><s%> that he should be the heir <S%G2818><s%> of the world, <S%G2889><s%> was not to Abraham, <S%G11><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> to his seed, <S%G4690><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> the law, <S%G3551><s%> but through <S%G1223><s%> the righteousness <S%G1343><s%> of faith. <S%G4102><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> they which are of the law <S%G3551><s%> be heirs, <S%G2818><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> is made <S%G2758><s%> void, <S%G2758><s%> and the promise <S%G1860><s%> made <S%G2673><s%> of none <S%G2673><s%> effect: <S%G2673><s%>

Because <S%G1063><s%> the law <S%G3551><s%> works <S%G2716><s%> wrath: <S%G3709><s%> for where <S%G3757><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> law <S%G3551><s%> is, there is no <S%G3761><s%> transgression. <S%G3847><s%>

Therefore <S%G1233><s%> <S%G5124><s%> it is of faith, <S%G4102><s%> that it might be by grace; <S%G5485><s%> to the end <S%G1519><s%> the promise <S%G1860><s%> might be sure <S%G949><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> the seed; <S%G4690><s%> not to that only <S%G3440><s%> which is of the law, <S%G3551><s%> but to that also <S%G2532><s%> which is of the faith <S%G4102><s%> of Abraham; <S%G11><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> is the father <S%G3962><s%> of us all, <S%G3956><s%>

(As it is written, <S%G1125><s%> I have made <S%G5087><s%> you a father <S%G3962><s%> of many <S%G4183><s%> nations, <S%G1484><s%>) before <S%G2713><s%> him whom <S%G3739><s%> he believed, <S%G4100><s%> even God, <S%G2316><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> vivifies <S%G2227><s%> the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and calls <S%G2564><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> things which be not as though they were.

Who <S%G3739><s%> against <S%G3844><s%> hope <S%G1680><s%> believed <S%G4100><s%> in hope, <S%G1680><s%> that he might become <S%G1096><s%> the father <S%G3962><s%> of many <S%G4183><s%> nations, <S%G1484><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to that which was spoken, <S%G2046><s%> So <S%G3779><s%> shall your seed <S%G4690><s%> be.

And being not weak <S%G770><s%> in faith, <S%G4102><s%> he considered <S%G2657><s%> not his own <S%G1438><s%> body <S%G4983><s%> now <S%G2236><s%> dead, <S%G3499><s%> when he was about <S%G4225><s%> an hundred <S%G1541><s%> years <S%G1541><s%> old, <S%G1541><s%> neither yet the deadness <S%G3500><s%> of Sarah's <S%G4564><s%> womb: <S%G3388><s%>

He staggered <S%G1252><s%> not at <S%G1519><s%> the promise <S%G1860><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> through unbelief; <S%G570><s%> but was strong <S%G1743><s%> in faith, <S%G4102><s%> giving glory <S%G1391><s%> to God; <S%G2316><s%>
And being fully <S%G4135><s%> persuaded <S%G4135><s%> that, what <S%G3739><s%> he had promised, <S%G1861><s%> he was able <S%G1415><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to perform. <S%G4160><s%>
And therefore <S%G1352><s%> it was imputed <S%G3049><s%> to him for righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> it was not written <S%G1125><s%> for his sake alone, <S%G3440><s%> that it was imputed <S%G3049><s%> to him;

But for us also, <S%G2532><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> it shall be imputed, <S%G3049><s%> if we believe <S%G4100><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> him that raised <S%G1453><s%> up Jesus <S%G2424><s%> our Lord <S%G2962><s%> from the dead; <S%G3498><s%>
Who <S%G3739><s%> was delivered <S%G3860><s%> for our offenses, <S%G3900><s%> and was raised <S%G1453><s%> again <S%G1453><s%> for our justification. <S%G1347><s%>
